How it works*

  • The customer approaches KCB in need of goods. KCB buys those goods from third party (Vendor) OR appoints the customer as the bank's agent to procure those goods on bank's behalf and deliver the goods to the bank.
  • The bank enters a sales contract with the customer to sell the goods to them on cost plus basis i.e. cost of goods plus a profit margin agreed beforehand.
  • The payment can be made on spot or on a deferred basis and the cost must be disclosed to the customer by KCB.

  • The customer approaches KCB in need of asset or project support.
  • KCB and the customer agree on proportion of contribution towards the required amount to obtain asset or complete project.
  • Further, KCB and customer agree on profit-sharing ratio for the period of the contract.
  • Depending on the type of partnership contract entered, KCB will share the relevant schedule to the customer with indicated profit and principal installments to be paid.
  • At the end of the contract, the customer will own asset or project concerned.

", "product_info_columns": [{"id": "lzihb9en", "type": "new_info_column", "enabled": true, "product_info_text": "

How it works*

  • The customer approaches KCB in need of goods. KCB buys those goods from third party (Vendor) OR appoints the customer as the bank's agent to procure those goods on bank's behalf and deliver the goods to the bank.
  • The bank enters a sales contract with the customer to sell the goods to them on cost plus basis i.e. cost of goods plus a profit margin agreed beforehand.
  • The payment can be made on spot or on a deferred basis and the cost must be disclosed to the customer by KCB.
"}, {"id": "m011ndoy", "type": "new_info_column", "enabled": false, "product_info_text": "

Rates & Fees*

  • Opening minimum balance – TZS 100,000 or USD 100.
